title: Ticket #120: Crondor jobs spam ScheddLog with "Requirements attribute...evaluated"
description:
The "Crondor" functionality works, in part, by manipulating the Requirements expression for a job. So you might end up with something like this: 

Requirements = (Arch == "INTEL") && (OpSys == "LINUX") && (Disk >= DiskUsage) && ((Memory * 1024) >=
ImageSize) && (((CurrentTime + ScheddInterval) >= (DeferralTime - DeferralPrepTime)) && (CurrentTime
< (DeferralTime + DeferralWindow)))

If the job is a local universe job, these will be periodically evaluated. When the job doesn't run (because its time hasn't come yet), you'll get log messages like this:

10/22 17:47:01 (pid:29249) The Requirements attribute for job 706.0 evaluated to false. Unable to start job

If you've got a few dozen Crondor jobs, each spraying this message every few minutes, your ScheddLog because hard to read, is full of scary things that you should ignore, and causes teh log to rotate unnecessarily.

Expected behavior: No log messages by default.

Proposed change: schedd.C lin 5967, change D_ALWAYS to D_FULLDEBUG.

Possible complications: This code handles all local universe jobs, not just Crondor. For "normal" local universe jobs, having Requirements evaluate to false may be problematic and worth logging; there is no other obvious place where the information is captured.

(Imported from 1698 (backup) 1698 (public))
